title: Employment Indicators
description:
This employment indicator series is intended to provide an early indication of changes in the labour market.
These indicators use a combination of data from two different Inland Revenue sources: the Employer Monthly Schedule (EMS) and payday filing.
keyword: ['Employment', 'ResourceID MEI1.1: Filled jobs and total gross earnings by high level industry', 'ResourceID MEI2.1: Filled jobs by industry', 'ResourceID MEI3.1: Filled jobs by age group and sex', 'ResourceID MEI4.1: Filled jobs by regional council', 'ResourceID MEI5.1: Filled jobs by regional council and sex', 'ResourceID MEI6.1: Filled jobs by regional council and age group']
distribution: [{'accessURL': 'https://api.stats.govt.nz/odata/v1/EmploymentIndicators', 'title': 'Employment Indicators', 'description': 'This employment indicator series is intended to provide an early indication of changes in the labour market.\nThese indicators use a combination of data from two different Inland Revenue sources: the Employer Monthly Schedule (EMS) and payday filing.', 'format': 'api'}]
publisher.name: Stats NZ

title: Overseas Cargo
description: Overseas cargo records all goods, value and gross weight, loaded or unloaded at sea or air ports.

title: Covid19 Indicators
description:
Stats NZ's COVID-19 data portal indicators gather key high-frequency indicators to help track the impact of COVID-19 on the economy.
  		Externally sourced data has not been verified by Stats NZ. Decision makers using the indicators should refer to the original indicator source to understand how the data was collected and issues such as sample error.

title: International Migration
description:
International migration measures long-term arrivals and departures to and from New Zealand. This is an outcomes-based measure of migration estimated from the actual travel histories of people travelling in and out of New Zealand.
  Before November 2018, Stats NZ classified travellers based on the intentions they stated on their passenger cards when they crossed the border. Calculating the actual travel duration (outcomes-based measure) is a more accurate way of measuring migration than relying on passenger card intentions. The outcomes-based measure is available back to January 2000.
  With the removal of the departure cards in November 2018, Stats NZ made methodological changes to producing the official measures of migration, tourism, and the estimates of population.
  For more informaiton refer to https://datainfoplus.stats.govt.nz/Item/nz.govt.stats/e2190954-9bd0-4ab9-81bd-4a5407de3f19

This is an outcomes-based measure of migration estimated from the actual travel histories of people travelling in and out of New Zealand.
  Before November 2018, Stats NZ classified travellers based on the intentions they stated on their passenger cards when they crossed the border. Calculating the actual travel duration (outcomes-based measure) is a more accurate way of measuring migration than relying on passenger card intentions. The outcomes-based measure is available back to January 2000.
  With the removal of the departure cards in November 2018, Stats NZ made methodological changes to producing the official measures of migration, tourism, and the estimates of population.

title: Household Labour Force Survey
description: Statistics New Zealand’s quarterly Household Labour Force Survey (HLFS) is used to produce official estimates of the numbers of employed and unemployed people, those not in the labour force, and the official unemployment rate for New Zealand.

title: Overseas Merchandise Trade
description: Overseas Merchandise Trade statistics provide statistical information on the importing and exporting of merchandise goods between New Zealand and other countries. Merchandise trade includes goods which add to or subtract from the material resources in New Zealand as a result of their movement in or out of the country. Data is obtained from export and import entry documents lodged with the New Zealand Customs Service (NZCS).
distribution: [{'accessURL': 'https://api.stats.govt.nz/odata/v1/OverseasMerchandiseTrade', 'title': 'Overseas Merchandise Trade', 'description': 'Overseas Merchandise Trade statistics provide statistical information on the importing and exporting of merchandise goods between New Zealand and other countries. Data is obtained from export and import entry documents lodged with the New Zealand Customs Service (NZCS).', 'format': 'api'}]

title: International Travel
description:
International travel covers the number and characteristics of overseas visitors and New Zealand resident travellers (short-term movements) entering or leaving New Zealand.
  		This is obtained from electronic passport and flight records, along with details from arrival cards for every passenger, supplied to Stats NZ by the New Zealand Customs Service.For more information refer https://datainfoplus.stats.govt.nz/Item/nz.govt.stats/f705ca38-ea6e-453f-b1d9-a95dc0fcaf59/121

title: National Accounts
description:
The conceptual framework used to compile New Zealand's national accounts and GDP is based on the System of National Accounts 2008 (2008SNA).
 The 2008SNA is jointly published by the United Nations, the Commission of the European Communities, the International Monetary Fund, the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development, and the World Bank.
 The 2008SNA was first introduced into New Zealand accounts at the end of 2014. Gross Domestic Product: June 2014 quarter was the last GDP release to use the 1993 version of the System of National Accounts.
  For more information:
  GDP quarterlies: https://datainfoplus.stats.govt.nz/Item/nz.govt.stats/9a9295f6-ce5f-4c71-8462-ba6dd01f4dc7#/nz.govt.stats/9a9295f6-ce5f-4c71-8462-ba6dd01f4dc7#
  GDP annual: https://datainfoplus.stats.govt.nz/Item/nz.govt.stats/48c58c28-4b3d-4a08-aa91-8af0f878c37d
  GDP improvements: https://www.stats.govt.nz/methods/improvements-to-gross-domestic-product
